info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Polk and west central Montgomery Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shady, or 8 miles southeast of Mena, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shady... Opal... Mena Intermountain Airport... Big Fork... Board Camp... Pine Ridge... Nunley... Cherry Hill in Polk County... Ink... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Arkansas.
